reviewText:
Pros:
- The Flashlight functions more like an actual flashlight than many horror games on Steam.
- The Ship environment was nice looking, most of the game is not like that.

Cons:
- One of the switchboxes needs a key to open it, but the game doesn't tell you that when you click it, I just stumbled across the key & then the game told me it was for the switchbox.
- A number of the levels" are just short corridors where you walk forward either through a couple of doors or press a switch
- A few of the graffiti things still had foreign language text in the English release
date: I guess they convey story or messaging
recommended: this really didn't explore the psyche or Locked-In Syndrome at all for me.\n- Most of it is drab corridors\n- Slow
hoursPlayed: unskippable intro that doesn't really tell me anything just reveals the title of the game which isn't spelled correctly.\n- Really long & slow elevator\cable-car rides\n- Character model has no grounding in the elevator/cable-car so they slide across as it moves in the opposite direction."

reviewText:
Well, I don't know about 'Locked-In Syndrome' but whoever developed the collision detection for this shoddy nonsense is definitely wielding some kind of mental deficiency. If you're a fan of attempting to descend ladders, only to suddenly no-clip through the wall and plunge to your death, this is the game you've been waiting your entire life for.
There's a little bit of work to get to that point; you'll have to beat down some ugly looking enemies with a metal pipe that only seems to connect every one in five swings but a little perseverance will see you through to what is unquestionably the best ladder fail simulator of 2016 so far.

Like trying to clamber down the clenching ♥♥♥♥♥♥ of a sick brontosaur. Astonishing." -IGN

"Rickety Stepladder Simulator 2015 and the infamous "Sperm Bank Inferno" stage from 911! Fire Heroes finally have a successor." -Gamer Haven

"The satisfying crunch of your body's skeleton detonating as it plunges through the ladder and its own supporting wall before meeting the floor two rooms away at speed has made me question whether I truly want to be with my wife or just hook an audio recording of it up to a Fleshlight." -PCMania

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VWQ2Rsp1NsI"

reviewText: To keep this short and sweet. Locked-In Syndrome is defiantly NOT a story of a man who has been closed in his own subconscious." There is no story.  You basically just walk/jump around
date: so now I will contradict the "Features" of the game.\n• ''First person exploration''- Yes it is.\n• ''Eerie high suspense atmosphere''- Kinda
recommended:
but not really. There's also some really annoying music at times.
• ''Shocking and immersive moments throughout the game''- Nope not even one.
• ''Solve intuitive puzzles and clues''- If you consider finding a key to open a door an "intuitive puzzle" then I guess so.
This game has many physics-based bugs where I got stuck countless times. Not to mention countless crashes
hoursPlayed: in the fact that the game doesn't even disable your mouse
voteText: so you're constantly clicking out of the game. Overall the game falls between bad and ok
helpfulPercent: but I don't recommend it.\nBut don't just take my word for it

reviewText: Sigh..This game is just Pure ♥♥♥♥♥. Its just a miss match of half life assets thrown together into a somewhat navigable level. The Flashlight is completely useless, you might as well just leave it off. I could see just fine without it. The combat is god awful there's no semblance of how much health you currently have its just, you get hit 4 times and you die. There's no red haze around the screen to tell you you're low on health or nothing. Just 4 hits *Therp* DED.\n\nThe Monsters are about as smart as a brick, I could kill them easily if i got them to run into a wall while i whack them with a pipe on the otherside of said wall. This first Puzzle" the game makes you go through is simple as all hell. You find a junction box that powers this lift that takes you across the darkness to another area. But you can't get at the Box because there's a gate in the way with a warning sign in Russian
date:
and its locked. allz you have to do is turn around and notice a mannequin sitting on a City 17 bench... And it holding the key.

Just take the key and unlock the gate open the junction box go through an animation of your guy flipping the switch (your guy is apparently a Oily reddish character) and then your useless flash light goes super nova and your blinded practically by this blue haze which didn't help you see through the darkness. Sigh i played a bit more and Trust me it doesn't get any better. OH Floating chairs..Wow T_T like i haven't seen that in countless other FREE games before.
Its nothing new at all.
I guess the ONLY enjoyment i got out of this game however fleeting was at the very start when the text on the ground told me to not jump in the water i thought "WHAT? You can't tell me what to do" and i jumped into the water and died. it put a smile on my face :)...and Then i had played the game..Sigh :/"

reviewText: I can not fully recommend it. You can give it a try on some sale but you loose nothing if you don't play it.  30-60 minutes of gameplay. First level was very promissing and I expected some kind of walking simulator full of abstractions but later it turned out pretty generic indie horror. Good thing is you have a weapon so you don't have to run away from everything. But also no zombie hordes attacking you which is often annoying in horrors where you have weapons. Few jumpscares present. And another good thing this game has less bugs and problems than most of Unity indie horrors nowadays, almost none I would say except sticky walls which affects jumping.

reviewText:
I'm impressed.  Confusing but still not difficult enough to be frustrating.  Every puzzle in chapter 1 was unique and it give me hope that the rest of the game will be equally enjoyable.

Graphics aren't bad either.  Good use of the unity engine.  It wasn't one of those lame horror games where you have seen it all before...  It was like, every few moments.. now what?  *searches around*.. OH!!  ...  Then stumped.. then OH!! All the while dying when I made mistakes.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y5bQPdJYkck
I would recommend it to people interested in a first person puzzle game in a creepy atmosphere.  BUT!  Keep in mind that it appears to be really short.  I did the first level and went to the level select and level 1 and 2 were already completed... they blended together so well that I didn't realize it was two chapters.  There are only like.. 7... So I tried out chapter 3, and got stuck at a part..  went to restart and I was apparently already on chapter 4.  So this is a game which may not take much more than an hour or two to complete.  Unfortunately.  If these next few chapters are the same length I might actually change my mind.

Recommendations?  Please make the mouse cursor bound to the window.  Had to disconnect my second display for this.

First up, the UI: A game like this should have more options than Good"

reviewText: Game with great atmosphere and solid potential utterly ruined by the atrocious controls. In my 25+ years of gaming I don't think I've ever actually stopped playing a game because the controls were bad. This was a first. The controsl are sloppy and mushy. Stages that require frame perfect jumps are made extremely tedious by the controsl and physics that make you feel like you're playing with gardeners gloves on. You'll end up needing to restart a level countless times because you get pinned between two soft, lightweight and moveable objects. Normally when you play game you're rewarded by a sense of learning and improving. This game actually makes you feel like you're getting worse the longer you play. The physics and controls are beyond clumsy. They're nonsensical and unpreditable. Very disappointed by what began as a promising experience.

reviewText: Terrible. Looks bad and handles worse. You control like a 400 lb man and will find yourself getting stuck on static options constantly. The enemies look like uneditted assets and become less intimidating and more annoying by the second. You randomly gain and lose the ability to fight with a weapon and in an attempt to give it an insane dream sequence feel it just comes off as unfocused and confused.

reviewText: So far the grapics, visuals and some of the UI are pretty good. However, the game needs some serious work. So much work that this game should be in Beta, not released. There's countless mechanical issues, sound issues, visual glitches and other annoyances. I can tell you put hundreds of hours into this game, and it's probably your first. In other words, keep working, it looks good so far!
